extendedInfo.description: Number Tap - the game of math, the game of skill...Number Tap is a new, addictive and fun maths game for your mobile device. You can boost your math skills whilst having fun. Are you ready to take the Number Tap Challenge?Features:- Addictive and fast-paced challenges; great for everywhere!- Improve and develop your mathematical skills whilst having fun!- A game mode for everyone; play to your abilities- Learn your addition & multiplication from the palm of your hand!Race against the ever-depleting clock in a race against time, solve various math equations as you work as fast as you can with optimum accuracy! Number Tap will keep you on the edge of your seat with the three different game modes:Easy:Test your brain and keep mentally active - this mode is great for younger players, math beginners and anyone looking for a small challenge without too much pressure!Â Medium:For the students and intermediate players. Do you think you can solve the equations in the given time. Medium mode will give you a challenge... Can you handle the numbers?Hard:Only for the experts! Feeling confident? This mode will test the player to their absolute limit. With near-impossible equations and little time to spare on each, be the best and race against the clock as you play with the big numbers!Select between the 2 game modes: Addition and Multiplication. Are you really as good as you think you are? With each new game mode comes a new challenge. Carefully work out the answer to the on-screen equation, enter your answer, tap the âequalsâ button and see if you are right - the next will flash and you will have to repeat the process! The time is running out - is your brain sharp enough to challenge the Number Tap app?Â Number Tap is a great game for the whole family - for those mathematics experts to the young beginners; everybody can enjoy the rush of Number Tap. If your child is learning their maths then Number Tap is the perfect revision companion. Number Tap is also a perfect game to play whenever you only have a few minutes to spare: keep your brain sharp whilst having fun doing so!Â Race against the clock, test your mathematical skills and train your brain - with Number Tap!Web: http://numbertap.net Twitter: @CraftyDeano

reviews.title: Bad ads good game
reviews.comment: I would give the game more stars but the ad pops over the number buttons which is bad when your are trying to play. There should be a better way to place the ad without putting it directly on the number keys. I like the game but not the ads.
reviews.author: Kelly Green

reviews.title: Horrible ads
reviews.comment: Way to easy to click the ads. Also on a slow connections the ad won\'t show until half way done with the next game. Super annoying being interrupted by ads in the middle of playing and pressing the screen bringing me into the ad
reviews.author: Sean Lavery

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Everything is good and well executed, just get rid of the equal button and make the submission automatically
reviews.author: Salem Sayed

reviews.title: Nice app!
reviews.comment: Fun and addictive! Good for kids as well!
reviews.author: Hans Valencia

reviews.title: There should should be no adds
reviews.author: Sati Wullabbs

reviews.title: Well designed and great challenge
reviews.comment: Very well designed UI and challenging. The lite version is very good and well worth the download. If you enjoy math puzzles or would like to learn more but in a fun way then you will enjoy this.
reviews.author: Tim Cox

reviews.title: Great math game
reviews.comment: Very quick and gives your brain a great workout. Very classy design. So happy to see this ported over from iOS.
reviews.author: Dean Murphy

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: Awesome game! Addicting and keeps your brain sharp. Also a great game for kids to play in the car\"
reviews.author: Andrei Maximov

reviews.title: Addictive classic
reviews.comment: Always nice to race against time in mental math games
reviews.author: Paolo Longato

reviews.title: Nifty
reviews.comment: Nice UI. Optimised for tablets. But I wish I didn\'t have to press equals.
reviews.author: Amrit Sultani

reviews.title: great math tool
reviews.comment: great tool to train your mind
reviews.author: Oshrat Raz
